title: For Trade:  MAUSER 308 BOLT ACTION, VERY CLASSY SPORTER W/ 130+ RNDS GOOD AMMO
postcontent:
Been hunting around for a good trade for this old school sporter. It is a Mauser arsenal chambered in 308 WIN / 7.62 NATO. Pretty classy looking sporterized walnut stock with modern sling studs. The steel of the receiver and barrel had been polished and blued and the finish is overal good. 2 lug bolt with 3 position safety (entire bolt is polished steel) and it operates smoothly as it should. Trigger is original and has NOT been modified. 5 round internal magazine with original "bolt stop" notch on the follower. Original fully adjustable leaf rear and front post sight. 21" military contour barrel with good bore and rifling. Receiver bears an ordnance crest, that I am told indicates it was Spanish Issue. The rifle feeds, fires and ejects as it should and there is no "bolt stick" like other surplus actions. Overall this is a unique and functional rifle in a common caliber. 
This package INCLUDES 134 rounds of ammo (as pictured) it is all brass cased factory loads and most of it is 168grain Match King hollow points. The leather cobra sling, limbsaver recoil pad and a soft padded AR rifle case are also included.

This is a REALISTIC $300-350 value. I am looking to trade this for another gun and I can some cash for the right gun. I'd prefer to meet in or NEAR Lafayette IN, but may split a reasonable drive for the right deal. Legal buyers only. Feel free to make a serious cash offer as well if you can meet locally. Asking $300 for the rifle/extras/case and $100+ worth of ammo, OR BEST OFFER.

title: For Sale:  Nelson Holsters Phoenix IWB Leather Holster for 1911
postcontent:
I'm selling my Nelson Holsters Phoenix IWB holster because I no longer have a 1911.  The holster is custom made for a 5" 1911 without a rail.  The holster hasn't been used that much and is only a couple of months old, but some of the top coat has come off.  It doesn't have any affect on the holster and is only a visual blemish.  Please see pics.

Asking just $35 for a nice quality leather IWB holster.  Cash only.

Please email or text to REDACTED.

From http://nelsonholsters.com/gallery-prices.html

Phoenix iwb holster information 

This holster is currently in use by the North Carolina State Bureau of Investigation.
________________________________
This holster is a mix of todays most popular and comfortable iwb holsters. It has features taken from Versa Max, Dakota Defender, Summer Special, N82 Holster and the Crossbreed. 

I have been working on this holster for about 2 years. It is designed for comfort from the ground up and has a smaller footprint than most, but has a larger back to contour to the users body without having the double layer of leather that at times can poke at you when you least excpect it. 

This is the IWB holster I now use when I carry inside the waist band.

Features 
________
1: Medical grade Neoprene backing with sweat wicking material that provides padding and comfort for the user as well as a sweat blocker that stops sweat from getting to the weapon. 

2: Wide loop attachment points to distribute the weight of the gun onto a larger area but without having a much larger holster body. 

3: Reinforced mouth for ease of reholstering.

4: Thiner body than most iwb holsters. No sharp edges to poke you. 

5: Sweat shield with combat cut to allow a full grip on the weapon.

6: Flatter back with most of the weapon away from the body (not a completely flat back but close) for comfort. Holster holds gun tight to the body for better concealment. 

7: Pull the dot snaps for security.

8: Hand sewn with the saddle sitch for more strength than a sewing machine lock sitch can provide.

9: Cant can be adjusted from roughly 12 to 27 degrees.

title: For Sale:  NEW Magpul CTR commercial stock + LaRue RISR cheek rest riser NEW
postcontent:
Brand New Magpul commercial spec CTR stock with LaRue Tactical RISR reciprocating inline stock riser!

Up for sale is a brand new combo package consisting of a Magpul commercial spec CTR stock and a LaRue tactical RISR reciprocating inline stock riser.

The CTR™ (Compact/Type Restricted) is a drop-in replacement butt stock for carbines using commercial-spec sized receiver extension tubes. Designed for light, fast action the streamlined A-frame profile avoids snagging and shields the release latch to prevent accidental activation. The CTR™ also features a supplemental friction lock system that minimizes wobble for enhanced weapon stability and accuracy. The CTR™ Stock includes a standard 0.30" rubber butt-pad which provides positive shoulder purchase to prevent slippage even with body armor or modular gear.

The LaRue Tactical RISR solves the age old dilemma that many owners have… It's a fact that some rifles need a cheek riser to get proper cheekweld and eye relief when using optics. It's another fact that standard charging handles require a lot of travel, making it impossible to charge a rifle without moving a collapsible stock all the way to the rear. The LaRue RISR solves these problems. The RISR is spring-loaded, and travels to the rear as the charging handle is moved to the rear. When the charging handle is released, the RISR snaps forward. Designed to fit the excellent Magpul CTR butt stock without modification, the RISR only takes a few minutes to install with a phillips-head screwdriver.

MSRP for the MagPul CTR stock is $100, MSRP for the RISR is $60, but our combined price for the pair is nearly half off! You can’t afford to pass this up!

(NOTE: Due to the many different manufacturers of commercial spec buffer tubes and the dimensional differences between them, we cannot guarantee a perfect fit on each and every buffer tube. For example, we know from experience that Bushmaster made buffer tubes are slightly larger than other tubes and as such the CTR stock is quite snug until the parts break in properly. However, most customers report that the CTR stocks fit most commercial spec buffer tubes without issue.)

MSRP is $160 for this combo, my price is only $85 and I SHIP FREE!

title: For Sale:  Spikes Tactical 14.5" 5.56/.223 DynaComp BAR-12 Upper Receiver
postcontent:
BRAND NEW IN BOX.. NEVER FIRED.!!
CALL OR TEXT ME @ REDACTED

Spike's Tactical Lightweight .223/5.56x45 caliber Complete Upper Receiver assemblies for AR15/M16 type Rifles. These rifles feature a 14.5" Light Weight barrel with permanently attached DynaComp muzzle break for 16" total length and Spike's 12" BAR 4 Rail Free Float Handguard. Complete Upper receiver assembly.

Specifications:

Spike's Tactical M4 flat top upper receiver, Machined from a 7075 T6 Mil-Spec Forging with Mil-Spec Type III Hard coat Anodized finish, T-markings, Spike’s logo and M4 feed ramps.
Barrel is certified MIL-B-11595E CMV. Bolt & barrel are HPT/MPI tested, M4 barrel extension, Chrome chamber and bore, 5.56mm Nato chamber, 1:7 Twist, Magnetic particle testing on every barrel, Phosphate finish.
Lightweight (Pencil) Profile with Mid-length gas system.
Barrel is Phosphate finished under the .625 pinned gas block.
The M16 carriers are Chrome lined with a Mil-Spec phosphate finish.
Forged Mil-Spec carrier key, Chrome lined, attached with Grade 8 hardware and Properly staked.
HP/MP Tested Bolt, Each extractor is fitted with a Mil-Spec black insert and Mil-Spec Viton o-ring.
Spike's Tactical 12" BAR 4 Rail Free Floating Handguard.
Pinned Spike's Tactical DyanComp Muzzle Break.

The Spike's Tactical 12” BAR Rail is a 1pc free floating quad-rail that’s machined from 6061-T6 Aluminum with a barrel nut machined from 7075-T6 Aluminum and finished in type III Hardcoat Anodizing on the rail and barrel nut. The 12” BAR rail weighs in at 479 grams (16.89 oz.) and has an ID of 1.79”.

The BAR rail also features scalloping on the rails that not only saves a little bit more weight but also allows you to run this rail without any rail covers! This sounds like an outlandish claim to those who have had their hands cut up on other quad-rails that have been lovingly called “cheese graters”. The BAR also offers excellent heat ventilation, built in anti-rotation tabs to keep the rail and even the barrel nut from coming loose, and of course; sexy styling.

But wait, there’s more! The BAR has 5 built in QD sockets (sling attachment points), allows for a continuous top rail, it’s compatible with many low profile gas blocks, and it’s made right here in the USA.

RAIL FEATURES:

1pc free float design
Rail is Machined from 6061-T6 Aluminum
Barrel nut is Machined from 7075-T6 Aluminum
Type III Hardcoat Anodized Black on the rail and barrel nut
Built in Anti-Rotation tabs
excellent heat ventilation, and sexy styling
Scalloped rails
5 Built in QD sockets (Sling attachment points)
Rail attaches to the barrel nut w/ (8) T-20 Grade 8 Torx screws
Continuous top rail
Compatible with Many Low profile gas blocks
Barrel nut works with standard USGI barrel nut wrench

Spike's Tactical Dynacomp Extreme muzzle break reduces felt recoil and helps combat muzzle climb. These muzzle breaks are Manufactured 303 Stainless Steel and feature a Melonited black finish for wear resistance from high volume shooting. Machined to be completely concentric, included threading, not taped after the fact. The ports are ball dimpled for optimal expansion of gases and heat dissipation. The Dynacomp's are also long enough to extend your 14.5" barrel to an ATF acceptable 16".

Spike's Tactical Complete 5.56 Bolt Carrier Group. Complete with Bolt Carrier, Bolt and Firing Pin, Military Spec. Heavy Phosphate Coated, and feature a properly staked gas key. BCGs are machines from Carpenter 158 Steel. Gas Keys are also hardened. HPT/MPI Bolt.

-Tool steel extractor, shot peened, 5.3.1.2 MIL-STD-171 phosphate finish, fitted with a Mil-Spec black extractor spring insert and Mil-Spec Viton o-ring.
-All bolts are Individually High Pressure Tested (HPT) and then Individually Magnetic Particle Inspected (MPI).
-All bolts are shot peened per the current Mil-Spec.
-Bolts have 5.3.1.2 MIL-STD-171 phosphate finish inside and out.
-Bolts are CNC machined from Carpenter No. 158®.
-Carrier key is attached with Grade 8 hardware and properly staked per the Mil-Spec.
-Carrier key has 5.3.1.2 MIL-STD-171 phosphate finish inside and out.
-Mil-Spec tool steel carrier key.
-Laser engraved with ST Spider logo (visable through ejection port door opening).
-Carrier has 5.3.1.2 MIL-STD-171 phosphate finish inside and out
-Mil-Spec 8620 tool steel M16 bolt carrier w/shrouded firing pin.

Bolt carrier group specifications-Spike's Tactical Complete Bolt Carrier Group. Complete with Bolt Carrier, Bolt and Firing Pin. Due to the dynamic changes in the modern battlefield, the threats of global terrorism and the demands of ever-changing combat situations, there was a need for a new versatile, innovative and technologically advanced weapon.

100% interchangeability with parts of the Tavor family, thus reducing the overall costs of the system.

• Increases hit probability under fatigue and pressure.

postcontent:
I have my Chinese Type 53 Project up for sale or trade today. I bought this rifle for the express purpose of refinishing and wood working. The Rifle has been well taken care of since I bought it last year. I have stripped and re stained the stock to the color you see in the pictures. I have also polished the lugs  on the bolt and deburred the chamber. Its in great condition given that it is a type 53. The bore of the rifle is in very good condition with no pitting and decent rifling left. Included with the rifle are the sling, 3 ammo pouches, cleaning rod. Again I purchased this rifle as a project gun and have only every fired it once and haven't taken it to the range since. 

Here locally in the Phenix City / Columbus area Type 53's sell for 199 just like any other Mosin Pattern Rifle around. But usually the stocks are beat up and in terrible condition, Same with the bolt and bore. This one like I said has been taken care of and was restoration project for me more than any thing.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Rare: COLT New Agent DAO (3" 1911) .45ACP looking for HK USP or others.
postcontent:
I purchased this gun brand new two weeks ago. I took it to the range and fired one box (50) through it and snapped the photo that you see right after. I was thrilled with the pistol. It was extremely accurate and smooth.

I brought it home and preceded to do a basic field strip per the manual to clean it well. During reassembly I lightly scratched the slid and receiver when reinserting the slide stop. This was the first 1911 based pistol I had ever cleaned and apparently this is a common mistake for us newcomers. So much so that if you Google, "1911 idiot scratches" you'll see. This made me feel a bit better about my error.

Nevertheless I have decided to part with Colt. This would make an awesome carry gun! I have tried to provide good quality photos for you to judge. The gun is literally as close to new as possible and it has proven to have tight tolerances by firing 50rds right out of the box with not a single feeding or ejection issue.

I am also including a very nice leather pocket holster and a Tex Shoemaker & Sons single mag pouch.

In some photos it may appear that the bluing is uneven this is ONLY the lighting. The finish is beautiful and consistent. One of the best Colt bluing jobs I've seen in years.
